data.title: Very Good Authentic Resturant
data.text: We ate there while visiting Long Beach. Long Beach has lots of restaurant choices and this one is on a side street and off the beaten path.  Service was very good and portions were large. You can easily split most things with a second person. The price was reasonable considering how much they gave you, and they had very good variety for a relatively small place.

data.title: Delicious crazy roll!!
data.text: We go to Kabob Curry at least once a month for their crazy roll!! Its has lamb meat, beef and chicken pieces in a naan with fresh vegetables and sauce. Dee-licious! And their prices are reasonable too :)

data.title: Excellent food, modest price
data.text: Very nice lunch experience, curry chicken dish, rice, salad-$9. Excellent wait staff, pleasant surroundings, convenient to LB Convention Center.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We had an excellent meal at Kabob Curry.  Staff was friendly.  The restaurant was not busy.  Food was delivered quite quickly.  Food was spicy but it is what we wanted.  It was a small building but clean.  Highly recommend if you want Indian food.

data.title: Good basic food
data.text: I hope you're not put off by the three stars - this restaurant serves a good, solid, meal.  It's not something amazingly special, but it's not bad either - it's right down the middle.  The one thing I LOVED was the mango lassi - really fresh and delicious.

data.title: Spicy delight
data.text: If you are in search for great Indian food at long beach this is just the right place for you, whenever I was around long beach I made it a point to have food here. This place serves delicious chicken Karachi and naan, chicken biryani is excellent too. Your search for finger licking food ends here. Must visit....!

data.title: Great Food and Service
data.text: My second time here for lunch, and navigating the crowd is worth it. Good Indian food in large portions, with good-value lunch specials that include salad and rice. I'd give the place 5 stars, but you may have to wait a bit for your food or your check when they are packed. Very tasty!

data.title: Entertainment coupon
data.text: The food was good. Only thing found hair in samosa. We had beef kabob with salad and rice. My husband had The mix meat. The waitress was friendly and nice only thing she is the only one. Desperately need help the place was busy and 1 person cannot do the job alone. The prices are fair. Only thing out of mango dessert.

data.title: Pretty good food.
data.text:
The food at this location was pretty good. The chicken Tandoori was really flavorful but the rice was a bit strange. I did not like the rice. The salad was good. I ordered Samosa which was actually one if the best I have ever had!! 

Overall I would go back and enjoyed my meal. Fast service!

data.title: Not at all worth.
data.text:
This is not that good restaurant. Service was poor. Food wasn't tasty and served fast. Water came in at the last moment.  Choice were there but choices were not healthy.
I don't like it. Please take some time to visit some other place.
There is a parking spot available just opposite to Kabob curry.

data.title: Good food, ok price
data.text:
Yeah great food.  Takes a little to prepare some times.  But big portions, amazing!!
Ordered out once and picked up the other time.

data.title: Nice food, nice service, delicious tea and desserts
data.text: We loved the vegetarian options and the complimentary free-flowing tea. We loved rice and aaloo naan with chana daal and aaloo saag. The hot gulab jamuns were very delicious as desserts. The tea reminded us of chai back home in India: same delicious taste. The best thing of all was the service that we received from an Asian girl. Sorry, we forgot to ask her name. She was very caring and helpful.

data.title: Good Indian Long Beach
data.text: I like the food not a big fan of the brunch. Small patio area dog freindly. Good value for the price.

data.title: Pakistani food in downtown Long Beach
data.text: Small restaurant with limited menu but what we had was uniformly excellent and made to our specifications (not spicey). The service consisted of one waitress who was constantly on the go but provided good service. The Indian tea was provided free if you went to the service bar where it was made. The interior was plain and there was outdoor dining, take out and delivery available.

data.title: Interesting Food, Could use more help
data.text:
While the service was a bit slow.  I blame management and NOT the workers.  Only one cook and one waitress on a Saturday night.  The waitress did her best and was helpful for this first time customer.   When I noticed Hatal listed on the menu, she explained the food was Pakistani, not Indian.  I have only eaten Indian once or twice and never had Pakistani I needed help ordering.
The food was good.   I don't know if it was authentic, or good Pakistani.  All I know is my wife and I liked it and will be back next time we are in town.  I would recommend that people give it a try and see for themselves.
Note I don't give many fives, a three is pretty good

data.title: Worst Food and Service Ever!!!
data.text: Stay Away!!! Went to have lunch buffet at Kabob Curry. Food was cold and tasteless. It took them 20 minutes to get us one price of bread. As my wife complaint politely to the person in-charge, instead of being apologetic, he got furious and started to yell and threaten us. Without eating, we paid the bill and got out of the restaurant. I have never seen such kind of attitude from a restaurant. Save your money, there are many more good Indian and Pakistani restaurants near by. Worst service and food ever!

data.title: Best Naan Around
data.text:
Cozy Indian/Pakistani Restaurant in Downtown Long Beach. The wait staff is not warm and cheery but I still give them an overall 5 because I've found that to be cultural. They were pleasant and provided good service.

First - the two items we went for, Lamb and Hummus, were not available. They no longer served Lamb due to lack of interest by patrons and they were out of hummus but things happen so I still gave them a a 5 because we had a great dinner with our alternate choices.

Beef Kabob Plate - basmati rice was well flavored, the chopped salad was incredible and the kabob itself was A+.

Saag - chicken with spinach and mustard greens in a spicy ginger/garlic sauce - Yummy

Aloo Naan (potato stuffed Indian bread) Awesome!

They offer a buffet on weekends. Can't wait to go back and try that as well.

data.title: Better Kabobs a few blocks away, but fewer dishes
data.text: I had a kabob which was OK.  They have a buffet on weekend that looked good.  I think i should have gone for something more on the Indian side.

data.title: Cheap and cheery
data.text: Stumbled upon this place, certainly an excellent alternative to your normal cheap and cheery restaurants. Very plain interior, they do a special every day which is quite tasty, good thing is that there is a fairly limited menu which suggests to me a good decision not trying to do too much and whilst they claim to be a curry house that's very much an American interpretation! I.e. they had not heard of popadoms! That said the food is tasty, decent servings, the rice is fantastic. No alcohol, and you can eat outside. They also do take out. Worth a visit if you are pushed for time!

data.title: Spicy curry wasn't spicy
data.text: I ordered the daily special called 'lamb pumpkin spicy curry' with cinnamon over bamati rice.  The menu board said it was boneless, but I got a dish-ful of bones.  Although the dish wasn't spicy as advertised and the curry overpowered the pumpkin flavor, I enjoyed it anyway since it was a unique combination of flavors.  A+ on creativity and novelty.
